required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trails of Photoelectrochemical Immunosensor for Early Diagnosis of Acute Myocardial Infarction
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trails of Photoelectrochemical Immunosensor for Early Diagnosis of Acute Myocardial Infarction
clinical_study.source: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this prospective randomized controlled clinical trial will evaluate the sensitivity, precision and effectiveness of photoelectrochemical immunosensor for early diagosis of acute myocardial infarction.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Sensitivityï¼Œprecision and cost of the photoeletrochemical immunosensor

arm_group.description: Automatic chemiluminescence analyzer will be used for dectecting the concentration of cardiac troponin I as control group.
Photoelectrochemical immunosensor will be used for dectecting the concentration of cardiac troponin I as test group.

intervention.intervention_name: Graphene quantum dots combined with Si nanowire photoelectrochemical immunosensor
intervention.description: Graphene quantum dots combined with Si nanowire is a new method of photoelectrochemical immunosensor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 years
- Symptoms of chest pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who will undergo immediate PCI Pregnant
- Lactating women
- Patients with mental disorders
- Patients are using other experimental drugs; Refusal to provide informed.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
responsible_party.investigator_title: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
